intro: Siphanthera pratensis, commonly known as the meadow siphon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Siphanthera pratensis is often found in disturbed or nutrient-rich soils, making it a common sight in grassy areas.
